title: Fan Gyhirych Walking Route

images.title: Dave Farmer / Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: Looking East from the summit of Fan Gyhirych towards Fan Nedd and Pen Y Fan

images.title: Alan Bowring / South-western slopes of Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: South-western slopes of Fan Gyhirych

images.title: Nigel Davies / Cray reservoir seen from Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: Cray reservoir seen from the hill. There is a small path right along the west edge of the summit of Fan Gyhirych from which you can get much better views below than you can at the trig pillar. Here we see north to the Cray reservoir with its wall at the far end.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Trig pillar on Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: Trig pillar. This is the summit that really makes the national park seem small. To the west you can see Fan Hir (pictured) - and to the east you can see the Corn Du and Pen y Fan. Both look to be just a couple of valleys away in either direction.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Upper northwest face of Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: Upper northwest face. Ascending from the lay-by to the west is quite steep going for the first 200 metres. With that done I can see the last 100 metres is far far worse. This is the view southeast showing the wall that awaits me as I climb on to the true summit high above.

images.title: Nigel Davies / Mountain track behind Fan Gyhirych
images.caption: Mountain track behind Fan Gyhirych. A pitted track runs along the level ground between Fan Gyhirych and Fan Fraith. Off in the distance, Corn Du and Pen y Fan can be seen on the horizon. Out of shot to the right is slightly lower land which turns out to be very boggy and so the track wisely avoids it.

description: This walk climbs to the  2379 feet (or 725 m) summit of Fan Gyhirych mountain in the Fforest Fawr section of the Brecon Beacons National Park. There are splendid views over the surrounding area and of Cray Reservoir below. The area is great for walkers as the entire hill is open country giving you the freedom to roam at will. The walk can be extended by continuing east to the nearby Fan Nedd.
